body: Sounds good :) Looking forward to a PR.
FWIW here is a PR on my own repo of the work in progress : https://github.com/vietj/netty/pull/2 it gives a good overview of the kind of changes done at the build
Please let me know how I can help, for example by rebasing the protobuf PR upstream. Excited to see energy around JPMS! ðŸ˜„
(You should find the path clear for errorprone and Guava dependencies as well, although Guava itself is still [pending](https://github.com/google/guava/pull/7094) and also needs a rebase.)
@sgammon anything that can get protobuf get declarative JPMS support is an awesome progress

issue.title: Invalid Java module
issue.body:
The jar of this library seems invalid because the jar contains a module-info and an automatic module name.

The automatic module name in the manifest should be removed.

issue.title: Upgrade com.fasterxml:aalto-xml and org.codehaus.woodstox:stax2-api to version declaring java module

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Upgrade `com.fasterxml:aalto-xml` from 1.0.0 to 1.3.3 and `org.codehaus.woodstox:stax2-api` from 4.0.0 to 4.2.2

Motivation:

Current versions of `com.fasterxml:aalto-xml` and `org.codehaus.woodstox:stax2-api` do not support the java module system. The latest version contain java module declaration (module-info) which are Java 8 binary compatibles.

Result:

The `netty-codec-xml` use `com.fasterxml:aalto-xml` and `org.codehaus.woodstox:stax2-api` versions containing java module declarations.

See #14176

body:
@vietj We have a repo called the "JPMS Attic" which can hold upstream artifacts before they release: https://github.com/elide-dev/jpms

I am happy to push additional artifacts there if at all helpful. That is where we perform integration tests with downstream libraries. I'll probably add Netty once this PR is fully formed. I'm also happy to help with downstream testing as we're big users of Netty in several places.

sounds great @sgammon I noticed this repo as well. 

do you think Protobuf Java will eventually accept your JPMS patch ?
@vietj I think it is likely but it may take awhile. In the meantime, the JPMS Attic already ships Protobuf with JPMS, so you can test against that. It will stay identical with my PR

Keep in mind that anything that has Guava in the dependency graph also is precluded from full JPMS support. So Guava and Protobuf will probably both be needed as I imagine Netty depends on Guava somewhere.

- protobuf is a static dependency for the protobuf codec
- fortunately Netty does not use Guava at all

so overall it is possible to support JPMS with jlink out of the box and I think we are looking quite solid

> @vietj I think it is likely but it may take awhile. In the meantime, the JPMS Attic already ships Protobuf with JPMS, so you can test against that. It will stay identical with my PR

we might be using this dependency in the testsuite-jpms for testing purpose
we could maybe also cleanup the netty-codec module and extract some modules (marshalling / protobuf) like the codec-xml, I'll open an issue for this
